list_definition.definition: (with for) to think that (one person or thing) is another

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I mistook you for my brother in this bad light.
They mistook the date, and arrived two days early.
It was a mistake to trust him
I took your umbrella by mistake – it looks like mine.

list_ex_of_english: On the face of it, these mistakes had little to do with the historical experience of the country.
The spelling mistakes are distracting (pp. 35, 157), and the endnotes are not practical, especially in the absence of a bibliography.
Insufficient generosity and uninformed views amongst the public were hindering social democracy as much as inadequate levels of economic growth or mistaken policies.
The findings are inconsistent with both frameworks, suggesting that both democratic peace and clash of civilizations claims are mistaken.
We hope that future studies will benefit from our mistakes and take advantage of our conclusions.
Should the agent warn only against possible mistakes, and simply register eective errors?
Since the inhabitants of both worlds would be missing only a minute amount of data however, we should expect such mistakes to be only occasional.
Failure in diagnosis is one of the most fundamental mistakes made.
